char.name: Sam Paul Khar'Ectr

I seek to prove myself worthy of my god’s favor by matching my actions against his or her teachings. (Any)","background_bond_choice":"I will do anything to protect the temple where I served.","background_flaw_choice":"I am inflexible in my thinking.","background_personality_choice1_array":"{\"name\":\"Personality Trait\",\"array\":[\"I idolize a particular hero of my faith, and constantly refer to that person’s deeds and example.\",\"I can find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working towards peace.\",\"I see omens in every event and action. The gods try to speak to us, we just need to listen\",\"Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude.\",\"I quote (or misquote) sacred texts and proverbs in almost every situation.\",\"I am tolerant (or intolerant) of other faiths and respect (or condemn) the worship of other gods.\",\"I've enjoyed fine food, drink, and high society among my temple’s elite. Rough living grates on me.\",\"I’ve spent so long in the temple that I have little practical experience dealing with people in the outside world.\"]}","background_personality_choice2_array":"{\"name\":\"Personality Trait\",\"array\":[\"I idolize a particular hero of my faith, and constantly refer to that person’s deeds and example.\",\"I can find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working towards peace.\",\"I see omens in every event and action. The gods try to speak to us, we just need to listen\",\"Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude.\",\"I quote (or misquote) sacred texts and proverbs in almost every situation.\",\"I am tolerant (or intolerant) of other faiths and respect (or condemn) the worship of other gods.\",\"I've enjoyed fine food, drink, and high society among my temple’s elite. Rough living grates on me.\",\"I’ve spent so long in the temple that I have little practical experience dealing with people in the outside world.\"]}","background_ideal_choice_array":"{\"name\":\"Ideal\",\"array\":[\"Tradition. The ancient traditions of worship and sacrifice must be preserved and upheld. (Lawful)\",\"Charity. I always try to help those in need, no matter what the personal cost. (Good)\",\"Change. We must help bring about the changes the gods are constantly working in the world. (Chaotic)\",\"Power. I hope to one day rise to the top of my faith’s religious hierarchy. (Lawful)\",\"Faith. I trust that my deity will guide my actions, I have faith that if I work hard, things will go well. (Lawful)\",\"Aspiration. I seek to prove myself worthy of my god’s favor by matching my actions against his or her teachings. (Any)\"]}","background_bond_choice_array":"{\"name\":\"Bond\",\"array\":[\"I would die to recover an ancient relic of my faith that was lost long ago.\",\"I will someday get revenge on the corrupt temple hierarchy who branded me a heretic.\",\"I owe my life to the priest who took me in when my parents died.\",\"Everything I do is for the common people.\",\"I will do anything to protect the temple where I served.\",\"I seek to preserve a sacred text that my enemies consider heretical and seek to destroy.\"]}","background_flaw_choice_array":"{\"name\":\"Flaw\",\"array\":[\"I judge others harshly, and myself even more severely.\",\"I put too much trust in those who wield power within my temple’s hierarchy.\",\"My piety sometimes leads me to blindly trust those that profess faith in my god.\",\"I am inflexible in my thinking.\",\"I am suspicious of strangers and expect the worst of them.\",\"Once I pick a goal, I become obsessed with it to the detriment of everything else in my life.\"]}"}},"l1-equipment":{"values":{"equipment_class":"Fighter","equipment_background":"Acolyte","equipment_type":"class","starting_gold":"0","class_equipment_choice1":"Items:Chain Mail","class_equipment_choice2":"Items:Net","class_equipment_choice6":"Items:Scimitar","class_equipment_choice3":"Items:Light Crossbow and Crossbow Bolts (20)","class_equipment_choice4":"Items:Dungeoneer's Pack","background_equipment_choice1":"Items:Prayer Book"}},"l1-summary":{"values":{}}}

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
I can find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working towards peace.

I idolize a particular hero of my faith, and constantly refer to that person’s deeds and example.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Aspiration. I seek to prove myself worthy of my god’s favor by matching my actions against his or her teachings. (Any)

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I will do anything to protect the temple where I served.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: I am inflexible in my thinking.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LMTei5Eb9qQ4n4qbMgK_description
attribs.current: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiX1-9s1PGaU5hpo_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiX1-9s1PGaU5hpn_itemcontent
attribs.current: A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiX04HPZbXVGRSpZ_itemcontent
attribs.current: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiX-Vx2IzqLzNICY_itemcontent
attribs.current: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiX-Vx2IzqLzNICY_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Damage: 1, Damage Type: Fire, Range: 20/40

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiWy2--DnZIu5OJR_itemcontent
attribs.current: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiWy2--DnZIu5OJQ_itemcontent
attribs.current: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiWwDlwddOaDS0eC_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Includes:

• a backpack

• a crowbar

• a hammer

• 10 pitons

• 10 torches

• a tinderbox

• 10 days of rations

• a waterskin

• 50 feet of hempen rope

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiWwDlwddOaDS0eB_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiWwDlwddOaDS0eA_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiWwDlwddOaDS0eA_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 80/320

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiWvIdBXlRPBJeVE_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Slashing

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiWuj4mJufG1SAgL_itemcontent
attribs.current: Special: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LMTeiWuj4mJufG1SAgK_itemcontent
attribs.current: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LMTeiWqJTss8CTZgodQ_description
attribs.current:
As an acolyte, you command the respect of those who share your faith, and you can perform the religious ceremonies of your deity. You and your adventuring companions can expect to receive free healing and care at a temple, shrine, or other established presence of your faith, though you must provide any material components needed for spells. Those who share your religion will support you (but only you) at a modest lifestyle.
You might also have ties to a specific temple dedicated to your chosen deity or pantheon, and you have a residence there. This could be the temple where you used to serve, or a temple where you have found a new home. While near your temple, you can call upon the priests for assistance, provided the assistance you ask for is not hazardous and you remain in good standing with your temple.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LMTeiWocLzpp5LkRWHc_description
attribs.current: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.
